title: Looking for a special K
content:
Hi all,

I was wondering if any of you could suggest a sans-serif font that has a 120º angle where the arm meets the leg of the capital letter ’K’ (what is that part called, the knee? [I looked around and couldn’t find the name of that particular part of the anatomy…])?

Thanks to anyone who can decipher my criptic writings and can give me a couple of ideas.

You guys rock.

-Adam

 [‹ (x) "Grappling Submission" square sci-fi display face - Electric Toaster {Mike Rohde (self)}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081008040657/http:/www.typophile.com/node/35871 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) "Mitch" distressed serif type - Caslon Antique (Casablanca Antique) {Mike F} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081008040657/http:/www.typophile.com/node/35906 "Go to next forum topic")
author: lazyeye88

comments.content:
You may have to draw this yourself - three strokes shouldn’t be that hard to do.

- Lex

Heh. I need a few more letters to go with the K. That is slightly out of my scope at this moment. It is important that the K has this feature though.

Thank you for the suggestion!

-Adam

I would guess that most ’K’s have an angle between 90 and 135 degrees. I’d suggest taking an existing font and modifying the ’K’ while keeping the other letters the same.

- Lex

Yeah, that just whacks out the proportions of the letter and the others don’t match up anymore, but it was worth a try!

-Adam
